Title: Sum of $k {n \choose k}$ is $n2^{n-1}$
Content: Proof that $\suṃ̣_{k=1}^{n}k {n \choose k}$ for $n \in \mathbb N$ is equal to $n2^{n-1}$. As a hint I got that $k {n \choose k} = n {n-1\choose k-1} $. I tried solving this by induction but, in the inductive step I'm not arriving to the correct result.
AcceptedAnswer: Just change the index $s=k-1$ $$\sum_{k=1}^{n}k {n \choose k} = n\sum_{k=1}^{n} {n-1\choose k-1}= n\sum_{s=0}^{n-1} {n-1\choose s} =n2^{n-1}$$
